fields.headline: Pop review: Lucinda Williams, Little Honey
fields.bodyText: Though chirpier - and less essential - than last year's brilliant West, the bones of Williams's unique brand (domestic dysfunction, doomed love, booze) remain beneath an eclectic, upbeat musical skin. The happy-in-love rockers are doggedly inessential, but ballads such as 'The Knowing' and 'Plan to Marry' redress the balance beautifully.
